title: CLAUDE.md
text: file provides guidance Claude Code (claude.ai/code) working code repository.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: R package (mdrelax) extends work master’s thesis “Reliability Estimation Series Systems” (located /home/spinoza/github/papers/reliability-estimation--series-systems/) implementing relaxed candidate set models go beyond traditional C1, C2, C3 conditions. Project Status: Early draft (v0.9.1), currently unstable. package extends masked data analysis allowing various candidate set structures beyond strict C1/C2/C3 conditions. Related Projects (use references): - Original Paper (/home/spinoza/github/papers/reliability-estimation--series-systems/): Master’s thesis extensive simulation studies Weibull series systems, BCa confidence intervals, comprehensive validation - Model Selection Paper (/home/spinoza/github/rlang/reliability-estimation--series-systems-model-selection/): Follow-work reduced models (homogeneous shape parameters) likelihood ratio tests - FIM Precursor (/home/spinoza/github/papers/expo-masked-fim/): Closed-form Fisher Information Matrix derivations exponential series systems

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Data generation scripts data-raw/:
code: devtools::load_all()           # Load for interactive development devtools::document()           # Generate documentation from roxygen devtools::check()              # Run R CMD check devtools::test()               # Run tests (tests need to be created) covr::package_coverage()       # Test coverage report pkgdown::build_site()          # Build documentation site source("data-raw/data.R")                    # Main data generation source("data-raw/exp_series_stats_1.R")      # Exponential series statistics

title: CLAUDE.md
text: md.tools (github::queelius/md.tools) - Masked data utilities encoding/decoding algebraic.mle (github::queelius/algebraic.mle) - MLE framework Fisher information support cubature - Numerical integration complex likelihoods

title: CLAUDE.md
text: series system fails component fails. mm components: - System lifetime: Ti=min{Ti1,Ti2,…,Tim}T_i = \min\{T_{i1}, T_{i2}, \ldots, T_{im}\} - System reliability: R(t;θ)=∏j=1mRj(t;θj)R(t;\theta) = \prod_{j=1}^m R_j(t;\theta_j) - System hazard: h(t;θ)=∑j=1mhj(t;θj)h(t;\theta) = \sum_{j=1}^m h_j(t;\theta_j)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Observed per system: 1. Right-censored system lifetime Si=min(Ti,τi)S_i = \min(T_i, \tau_i) indicator δi\delta_i 2. Candidate set CiC_i system fails (components caused failure) 3. Component failure times TijT_{ij} observed Key challenge: Failed component KiK_i latent constrained Ki∈CiK_i \C_i

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Condition 1 (C1): Failed component always candidate set: Pr{Ki∈Ci}=1\Pr\{K_i \C_i\} = 1 Condition 2 (C2): Non-informative masking within candidate set (equal probabilities candidates given system failure time) Condition 3 (C3): Masking independent system parameters θ C1, C2, C3, likelihood contribution failed system time tt candidate set cc : Li(θ)∝R(t;θ)×∑j∈chj(t;θj)L_i(\theta) \propto R(t;\theta) \times \sum_{j \c} h_j(t;\theta_j)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: package relaxes conditions, particularly: - Relaxed C1: enforce failed component candidate set - Informed masking: Probability depends component failure ranks (simulation-friendly) - KL-divergence constraints: Control “informativeness” relative baseline Bernoulli model

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Candidate Set Models: - md_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3() - Traditional uninformed Bernoulli model - md_bernoulli_cand_C1_kld() - Relaxed model KL-divergence baseline - md_cand_sampler() - Generate candidate sets probability vectors - md_block_candidate_m3() - Block model demonstrating non-identifiability Estimation: - md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3() / md_mle_weibull_series_C1_C2_C3() - MLE computation - md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3() / md_loglike_weibull_series_C1_C2_C3() - Log-likelihood - md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3() / md_score_weibull_series_C1_C2_C3() - Score functions - md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3() - Fisher information matrix

title: CLAUDE.md
text: α → 0: uniform distribution non-failed components α → ∞: failed component rank-2 component included β: maximum weight rank-2 component generate_relaxed_cand_C1(d, ts, p, ...) - Find Q target KL-divergence P kl_divergence_bernoulli(p, q) - KL divergence Bernoulli vectors

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Standard R naming (d/p/q/r): - Exponential: dexp_series_system(), pexp_series_system(), qexp_series_system(), rexp_series_system() - Weibull: dweibull_series(), pweibull_series(), qweibull_series(), rweibull_series() - Hazard/Survival: hazard_exp_series_system(), survival_exp_series_system(), etc.

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Extract component times from prefixed columns (t1, t2, ..., tm → matrix) Tm <- md_decode_matrix(md, "t")  # Encode probabilities back to data frame (matrix → q1, q2, ..., qm) md <- md %>% bind_cols(md_encode_matrix(Q, "q"))  # Mark columns as latent md <- md %>% md_mark_latent(paste0("q", 1:m))

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Generate/Load masked data component times (t1, t2, …, tm) md_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3(md, p=0.3) traditional model md_bernoulli_cand_C1_kld(md, p=0.3, d=0.5) relaxed model Sample candidate sets using md_cand_sampler(md) → creates (x1, x2, …, xm) Compute MLE using md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md) Weibull variant Analyze using standard MLE methods (confidence intervals, hypothesis tests)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: test suite exists - tests/ directory needs populated Optimization failures - Functions use tryCatch; convergence guaranteed Bug informative_masking_by_rank(): Uses undefined alpha0/beta0 instead alpha/beta parameters (line 56-57) grad_descent defined: generate_relaxed_cand_C1 calls grad_descent utils.R defines grad_ascent Identifiability: candidate set structures produce non-unique MLEs (see md_block_candidate_m3)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: original thesis (wei.series.md.c1.c2.c3 package) provides validated implementations. Key simulation findings work: - MLE performs well even significant masking (p 0.4) censoring (40%) - BCa confidence intervals good coverage probability - Shape parameters harder estimate scale parameters - Larger samples (n ≥ 250) provide reliable estimates

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
text: mdrelax package provides tools likelihood-based inference series systems masked failure data. vignette demonstrates basic workflow using exponential component lifetimes.

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
code: library(mdrelax)

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
text: simulate series system 3 components exponential lifetimes rates λ=(1.0,1.5,2.0)\lambda = (1.0, 1.5, 2.0).
code: set.seed(42)  # True parameters lambda_true <- c(1.0, 1.5, 2.0) n <- 100  # sample size m <- 3    # number of components  # Generate component failure times T_mat <- matrix(rexp(n * m, rate = rep(lambda_true, each = n)),                 nrow = n, ncol = m)  # System failure time is minimum of component times t_sys <- apply(T_mat, 1, min)  # Identify which component failed (latent) k_failed <- apply(T_mat, 1, which.min)  # Create data frame with component times md <- data.frame(   t = t_sys,   t1 = T_mat[, 1],   t2 = T_mat[, 2],   t3 = T_mat[, 3],   delta = rep(1, n)  # all observed (no censoring): delta=1 means failure observed )

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
text: standard C1-C2-C3 conditions, apply Bernoulli masking non-failed component included candidate set probability pp. columns x1, x2, x3 indicate components candidate set (1 = candidate set, 0 = candidate set).
code: # Apply Bernoulli masking with p = 0.3 md <- md_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3(md, p = 0.3)  # Sample candidate sets md <- md_cand_sampler(md)  # View first few rows head(md[, c("t", "x1", "x2", "x3")]) #>             t    x1    x2    x3 #> 1 0.198336812  TRUE FALSE FALSE #> 2 0.064822223  TRUE FALSE  TRUE #> 3 0.124212025  TRUE FALSE  TRUE #> 4 0.038191898  TRUE FALSE  TRUE #> 5 0.250735989 FALSE FALSE  TRUE #> 6 0.000824189  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
text: compute MLE component rate parameters:
code: fit <- md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md) print(fit) #> Maximum likelihood estimator of type mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3 is normally distributed. #> The estimates of the parameters are given by: #> [1] 1.226501 1.075383 1.525874 #> The standard error is  0.2588029 0.2361879 0.2839848 . #> The asymptotic 95% confidence interval of the parameters are given by: #>             2.5%    97.5% #> param1 0.7192569 1.733746 #> param2 0.6124630 1.538303 #> param3 0.9692738 2.082474 #> The MSE of the individual components in a multivariate estimator is: #>              [,1]         [,2]         [,3] #> [1,]  0.066978964 -0.006206286 -0.013825185 #> [2,] -0.006206286  0.055784723 -0.008415402 #> [3,] -0.013825185 -0.008415402  0.080647362 #> The log-likelihood is  -39.0219 . #> The AIC is  84.0438 .

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
code: # Extract point estimates using algebraic.mle accessor estimates <- algebraic.mle::params(fit)  # Compare to true values comparison <- data.frame(   Component = paste0("lambda_", 1:m),   True = lambda_true,   Estimate = estimates,   Bias = estimates - lambda_true ) print(comparison) #>   Component True Estimate       Bias #> 1  lambda_1  1.0 1.226501  0.2265013 #> 2  lambda_2  1.5 1.075383 -0.4246173 #> 3  lambda_3  2.0 1.525874 -0.4741262

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
text: Fisher Information Matrix provides information estimation precision:
code: # Create FIM function and evaluate at MLE fim_fn <- md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md) fim <- fim_fn(estimates) print(fim) #>           [,1]      [,2]      [,3] #> [1,] 15.737278  2.192326  2.926569 #> [2,]  2.192326 18.518158  2.308160 #> [3,]  2.926569  2.308160 13.142209  # Standard errors from inverse FIM se <- sqrt(diag(solve(fim))) cat("\nStandard errors:", round(se, 4), "\n") #>  #> Standard errors: 0.2588 0.2362 0.284

title: Exponential Series Systems with Masked Data
text: vignette demonstrated: Simulating exponential series system data Applying Bernoulli masking C1-C2-C3 conditions Computing MLE component rate parameters Evaluating estimation precision via Fisher Information Matrix advanced usage including informative masking models relaxed conditions, see package documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alexander Towell. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Towell (2025). mdrelax: Relaxed Candidate Set Models Masked Data Series Systems. R package version 0.9.1, https://queelius.github.io/mdrelax/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mdrelax: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems},   author = {Alexander Towell},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.9.1},   url = {https://queelius.github.io/mdrelax/}, }

what: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
title: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
text: Relaxed Candidate Set Models Masked Data Series Systems

title: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
text: R package implements likelihood-based inference series systems masked failure data traditional conditions relaxed. extends standard C1-C2-C3 framework allowing: Informative masking (relaxed C2): Candidate set probabilities can depend component failed Parameter-dependent masking (relaxed C3): Masking mechanism can depend system parameters Flexible candidate set models: Bernoulli, rank-based, KL-divergence constrained models

title: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
code: # Install from GitHub remotes::install_github("queelius/mdrelax")

title: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
text: Maximum likelihood estimation exponential Weibull series systems Fisher information matrix computation efficiency analysis Informative masking models (rank-based, KL-constrained) Identifiability analysis tools Simulation utilities Monte Carlo studies

title: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
code: library(mdrelax)  # Generate masked data with Bernoulli candidate sets md <- md_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3(data, p = 0.3)  # Sample candidate sets md <- md_cand_sampler(md)  # Compute MLE for exponential series system fit <- md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md)  # Get Fisher information matrix fim <- md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md, params(fit))

title: Relaxed Candidate Set Models for Masked Data in Series Systems
text: series systems masked failure data: - system fails component fails - failed component directly observed - candidate set possible failed components reported Traditional analysis assumes: - C1: Failed component always candidate set - C2: Non-informative masking (uniform probability within candidate set) - C3: Masking independent system parameters package provides tools inference C2 /C3 violated.

title: informative_masking_by_rank — informative_masking_by_rank
text: ts component failure times series system alpha rate change respect rank, alpha -> 0 probabilities go discrete uniform distribution beta max weight (ranked 2 component)

title: informative_masking_by_rank — informative_masking_by_rank
text: shape masking given two parametrs, alpha, must non-negative, beta, must 0 1. alpha goes 0, probability vector approaches (beta, beta, ..., 1, beta, ..., beta) 1 failed component alpha goes infinity, assigns probability 1 beta respectively rank 1 (failed component) rank 2 components (remaining probabilities zero).

what: Generate masked data for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3
title: Generate masked data for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3
text: Generates synthetic masked failure data exponential series system using Bernoulli candidate set model satisfying C1, C2, C3 conditions.

title: Generate masked data for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3
code: md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3(n, rates, p, tau)

title: Generate masked data for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3
text: n Sample size (number systems). rates Vector exponential rate parameters component. p Probability non-failed component candidate set. tau Right-censoring time. Can scalar () vector.

title: Generate masked data for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3
text: masked data frame columns: t1, t2, ..., tm: Component failure times (latent) t: System failure time k: Index failed component (latent) delta: Censoring indicator (TRUE = censored) q1, ..., qm: Candidate set probabilities x1, ..., xm: Candidate set indicators

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ set.seed(42) md <- md_exp_series_system_bernoulli_cand_C1_C2_C3(   n = 100,   rates = c(1, 1.5, 2),   p = 0.3,   tau = 2.0 ) } # }

what: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
title: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: Returns function computes observed Fisher information matrix (FIM) exponential series system masked data C1, C2, C3 conditions.

title: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md, sysvar = "t", setvar = "x", deltavar = "delta")

title: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: md Masked data frame containing: System lifetime column (default: "t") Candidate set columns (default: "x1", "x2", ..., "xm") Optional right-censoring indicator (default: "delta") sysvar Column name system lifetime. Default "t". setvar Column prefix candidate set (Boolean matrix). Default "x". deltavar Column name right-censoring indicator. Default "delta". NULL column exist, assumes censoring.

title: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: function (theta) computes m x m observed Fisher information matrix parameter values theta.

title: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: observed FIM negative Hessian log-likelihood, regularity conditions converges expected FIM can inverted obtain asymptotic variance-covariance matrix MLE. (j,k) element observed FIM : $$I_{jk}(\theta) = \sum_{: \delta_i=0} \frac{(j \C_i) (k \C_i)}{(\sum_{l \C_i} \lambda_l)^2}$$ Note: survival contribution Hessian zero (second derivative linear term zero), uncensored observations contribute.

title: Observed Fisher information matrix for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ md <- tibble::tibble(   t = c(0.5, 1.2, 0.8),   x1 = c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE),   x2 = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),   x3 = c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE) ) fim <- md_fim_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md) fim(c(1, 1.5, 2)) } # }

what: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
title: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: Returns log-likelihood function exponential series system masked component cause failure candidate sets satisfying conditions C1, C2, C3.

title: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(   md,   sysvar = "t",   setvar = "x",   deltavar = "delta" )

title: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: md Masked data frame containing: System lifetime column (default: "t") Candidate set columns (default: "x1", "x2", ..., "xm") Optional right-censoring indicator (default: "delta") sysvar Column name system lifetime. Default "t". setvar Column prefix candidate set (Boolean matrix). Default "x". deltavar Column name right-censoring indicator. Default "delta". NULL column exist, assumes censoring.

title: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: function f(theta) computes log-likelihood given rate parameters theta = (lambda_1, ..., lambda_m).

title: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: series system m components exponential lifetimes rate parameters theta = (lambda_1, ..., lambda_m): System reliability: R(t) = exp(-sum(theta) * t) System hazard: h(t) = sum(theta) observation system lifetime s_i, right-censoring indicator delta_i, candidate set C_i: uncensored (delta_i = FALSE): L_i(theta) = R(s_i) * sum_{j C_i} h_j(s_i) censored (delta_i = TRUE): L_i(theta) = R(s_i) log-likelihood : $$\ell(\theta) = \sum_i \log L_i(\theta)$$ uncensored observations: $$\log L_i(\theta) = -s_i \sum_{j=1}^m \lambda_j + \log\left(\sum_{j \C_i} \lambda_j\right)$$ censored observations: $$\log L_i(\theta) = -s_i \sum_{j=1}^m \lambda_j$$

title: Log-likelihood function for exponential series system with masked data (C1,C2,C3) — md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Generate some masked data md <- tibble::tibble(   t = c(0.5, 1.2, 0.8),   x1 = c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE),   x2 = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),   x3 = c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE),   delta = c(FALSE, FALSE, TRUE) ) ll <- md_loglike_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md) ll(c(1, 1.5, 2))  # Evaluate at theta = (1, 1.5, 2) } # }

what: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
title: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: Computes MLE component failure rates exponential series system masked data C1, C2, C3 candidate set conditions.

title: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(   md,   theta0 = NULL,   sysvar = "t",   setvar = "x",   deltavar = "delta",   use_annealing = FALSE,   control = list(),   lower = 1e-10,   upper = Inf,   hessian = TRUE )

title: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: md Masked data frame containing: System lifetime column (default: "t") Candidate set columns (default: "x1", "x2", ..., "xm") Optional right-censoring indicator (default: "delta") theta0 Initial parameter values optimization. NULL, uses method moments estimator based total system hazard. sysvar Column name system lifetime. Default "t". setvar Column prefix candidate set (Boolean matrix). Default "x". deltavar Column name right-censoring indicator. Default "delta". NULL column exist, assumes censoring. use_annealing Logical. TRUE, uses simulated annealing find good starting point local optimization. Default FALSE. control List control parameters passed optim(). Default uses L-BFGS-B reasonable settings. lower Lower bounds parameters. Default 1e-10. upper Upper bounds parameters. Default Inf. hessian Logical. TRUE, compute Hessian MLE. Default TRUE.

title: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: object class mle (algebraic.mle package) containing: theta.hat: MLE rate parameters sigma: Estimated variance-covariance matrix loglike: Log-likelihood MLE info: Observed Fisher information matrix nobs: Number observations converged: Whether optimization converged

title: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: Uses L-BFGS-B optimization optional simulated annealing finding good starting point. MLE exponential series systems masked data closed-form solution special cases. general, numerical optimization required. function uses L-BFGS-B algorithm analytically computed gradients efficiency.

title: Maximum likelihood estimator for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Generate masked data library(tibble) set.seed(42) n <- 100 theta_true <- c(1, 1.5, 2) # ... (data generation code)  mle <- md_mle_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md, theta0 = theta_true) print(mle) confint(mle) } # }

title: Score function (gradient of log-likelihood) for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: Returns score function (gradient log-likelihood respect theta) exponential series system masked data C1, C2, C3 conditions.

title: Score function (gradient of log-likelihood) for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(   md,   sysvar = "t",   setvar = "x",   deltavar = "delta" )

title: Score function (gradient of log-likelihood) for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: md Masked data frame containing: System lifetime column (default: "t") Candidate set columns (default: "x1", "x2", ..., "xm") Optional right-censoring indicator (default: "delta") sysvar Column name system lifetime. Default "t". setvar Column prefix candidate set (Boolean matrix). Default "x". deltavar Column name right-censoring indicator. Default "delta". NULL column exist, assumes censoring.

title: Score function (gradient of log-likelihood) for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: function g(theta) computes score (gradient) vector parameter values theta = (lambda_1, ..., lambda_m).

title: Score function (gradient of log-likelihood) for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
text: score component j : $$\frac{\partial \ell}{\partial \lambda_j} = -\sum_i s_i + \sum_{: \delta_i=0} \frac{(j \C_i)}{\sum_{k \C_i} \lambda_k}$$ (j C_i) 1 component j candidate set C_i, 0 otherwise.

title: Score function (gradient of log-likelihood) for exponential series system (C1,C2,C3) — md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ md <- tibble::tibble(   t = c(0.5, 1.2, 0.8),   x1 = c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE),   x2 = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),   x3 = c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE) ) score <- md_score_exp_series_C1_C2_C3(md) score(c(1, 1.5, 2)) } # }

text: Modified data frame additional columns: System lifetime (sysvar) Censoring indicator (deltavar): TRUE censored Failed component index (failvar)
